abstracts.cdata!:
This is a project completion report of
            the Preinvestment Studies Project in Colombia. The project
            was useful and, by contributing to cash requirements during
            a period of rapid expansion, helped to establish FONADE
            (government preinvestment agency) as a central point in
            project preparation. The transfer of Bank experience in
            project preparation in general and in certain sectors in
            particular was only partially successful, due in part to
            staff changes in FONADE. The main areas which could be
            addressed by FONADE, apart from internal procedural
            improvements are: i) institutional assessment of
            non-traditional sub-borrowers, with technical assistance
            where required; ii) monitoring report implementation, with
            early identification of areas of difficulty and technical
            assistance where required; iii) monitoring of relationships
            between study forecasts and final outcome, and use of the
            resultant material to improve study design and supervision;
            iv) improving access to foreign exchange when required; v)
            assessing the objectives of the relationship between foreign
            and local consultants, and serving as a center for
            suggestions for legislative reform; and vi) further
            development of FONADE's promotional role to achieve a
            better sectoral balance of projects.
